sheet6.c_bookDatabase

Class BookDatabaseInteractiveConsoleTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.InteractiveConsoleTest
      • sheet6.c_bookDatabase.BookDatabaseInteractiveConsoleTest

  • public class BookDatabaseInteractiveConsoleTest
extends InteractiveConsoleTest
    A test for the Interactive Console (Task C)

    People that checked this test for being correct and complete:
    • Martin L�per


    Things that are currently not tested, but should be:
    • Several search queries: whitespace-ignore, case-sensitivity ignore (especially for AND/OR), nested searchqueries (depth: >5), malformed searchqueries (e.g. AD(title=a,creator=b))
    Since:
    29.01.2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin L�per

      • cliInvalidFirstParam

        public void cliInvalidFirstParam()
        Starts program with two cli parameter. The second one is valid, but the first one is not a float. Asserts that:
        • the program terminates
        • if System.exit(x) is called, x>0
        • an error message is printed

      • cliInvalidFirstParam2

        public void cliInvalidFirstParam2()
        Starts program with two cli parameter. The second one is valid, but the first one does not match the boundaries [0,1]. Asserts that:
        • the program terminates
        • if System.exit(x) is called, x>0
        • an error message is printed

      • cliValidFirstParam

        public void cliValidFirstParam()
        Starts program with two cli parameter. Both are valid, but it might not be as obvious. Asserts that:
        • the program terminates
        • if System.exit(x) is called, x=0
        • no error message is printed

      • cliValidFirstParam2

        public void cliValidFirstParam2()
        Starts program with two cli parameter. Both are valid. this does test the boundaries [0,1]. Asserts that:
        • the program terminates
        • if System.exit(x) is called, x=0
        • no error message is printed

      • cliValidArgAndQuit

        public void cliValidArgAndQuit()
        Starts program with valid cli parameters. Tests the quit command. Asserts that:
        • the program terminates
        • if System.exit(x) is called, x=0
        • no error message is printed

      • publicTest

        public void publicTest()
        Simulates the Praktomat's public test. Asserts that:
        • the program outputs the expected search responses.
        • an error message is printed (key isbn not allowed)
